Reviews.Title: “A RUN-DOWN, UNFRIENDLY, BADLY MANAGED HOTEL: AVOID IT AT ALL COST !”
Reviews.Author: supersamtrieste
Reviews.Content: a warm advise to all readers! avoid this hotel at all costs. its ONLY advantage is its central location and fine view from the (noisy) street facing rooms and roof top terrace. for the rest we found it very run down (electrical plugs falling down from the walls, wall paint peeling out, holes in bedsheets and so on...). behaviour of the receptionists -after you happen to refuse their insistent proposal of (expensive) guided tours- is between cold and unfriendly to even hostile. internet connection in the lobby is very slow and often pcs are kept switched off to spare electricity. waiters in the breakfast room appear absolutely unexperienced and speak almost no english at all, furtehromore we had to wait a very long time every single day to have coffee, they just didn't bother to pass through tables with coffee pots unless you shouted at them! as final deception i can tell you they even tried to ask full PRE-payment of the room on arrival: just too bad! this was our worst hotel experience in istanbul. never again!

Reviews.Title: “Big thank you for wonderful stay! :-)”
Reviews.Author: katarzyna n
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Hali many times, last time at the end of last year and beginning of the new one. I choose this hotel for many reasons - it's conveniently located in the very heart of Sultanahmet, the historic part of Istanbul, in a side lane, which makes it a very quiet and sort of secluded. It's within walking distance to most tourist attractions, resaurants, shops, bazaars. The rooms, which are cleaned every day, are comfortable, with very clean bedlinen. Wifi and access to English language TV channels allow me to keep in touch with the life outside Istanbul. The views from the room windows are stunning - Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace almost right at your feet, and if you go to the roof restaurant terrace, you can add the Marmara sea and the Golden Horn Bay with the famous bridge over it. It's a unique pleasure to sit in the roof restaurant watching the seaguls landing on the terrace and the sun going up between the minarets of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast they serve in the restaurant, including among numerous other things salted cottage cheese, olives, rose jam and Turkish tea is absolutely delicious! I also liked the service in the hotel: in the restaurant, at the reception and the cleaning service - they were helpful. The receptionists were helpful when approached in person or by email and by phone. It was not a problem for them, e.g. to look after my luggage for a few hours until my take off in the afternoon, which enabled me to spend a few more hours exploring the city. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in a friendly place, with great location, comfy rooms, helpful staff and good breakfast :-) I look forward to staying in Hali again! Thank you for your hospitality! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect for seasoned travelers”
Reviews.Author: Saaaailor
Reviews.Content: Hali hotel is located in the exact center of historic Istanbul, Sultanahmet, with a breath-taking view of Hagia Sophia and less than a 5 minute stroll from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the new Islamic & Turkish Arts museum, the Archeological Museum, Chemberlitash Hamam ... well just Google the location and check the Top 10 Things to Do Guide from Eye-Witness Guides and you will get the picture. We spent two weeks at Hali Hotel during the Christmas and New Years holidays, 2011-2012. Not only did Cengiz, the Reservations Manager, give us a perfect room with a view of the Bosphorus and Hagia Sophia, he introduced us to Ihan and Ibrahim, who took care of us 24 hours a day, no matter if we were looking for touristy info, champagne glasses or a midnight Turkish coffee. These guys embody Turkish hospitality and aimed to make our stay unforgettable. They succeeded. So, if you're looking to spend a day or a month in the historic center of Istanbul with a view of the Golden Horn, the Bosphorus AND the Sea of Marmarus to compliment your morning coffee, look no further than this place. We're going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View near Tourist hotspots”
Reviews.Author: Patrickofsingapore
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at Hali for over 7 years when I visit Istanbul yearly. Its the view from the 5th Floor terrace area where you have breakfast, that's truely spectacular. It overlooks the Blue Mosque, Hagai Sophia and the Bosphorus and Sea of Mamara. Location could not be better and walking distance to major tourist attractions in the Old City, including Grand Bazaar. Service is friendly and if they have cleaned rooms will let you check in if you arrive early. Rooms on the small side but comfortable and the rates are reasonable. Hope you have a good time. Patrick from SIngapore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view and location”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry P
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istandul and i can say I chose the right place to stay. Location was just right for a 5-day trip - it allowed us to see all the historic centre. The staff was ok, nothing to complain about. Many hotels in this area have scenic terraces on the roof where you can have breakfast with a view on Ayasofya, Sea of Marmara and a piece of Blue Mosque at a time. I must say the breakfast itself was pretty poor so i had to have an early lunch just after. There was another small problem - not enough hot water in mornings, at the time everyone takes shower before breakfast. Probably it all can be forgiven for the view, location and price. And don't forget to take a Bosphorus boat trip!

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Amy G
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our week at Hali Hotel in Sept 2011. Very interesting part of city near major historic buildings,in road off main caddesi with the scary trams. Next door to carpet shops hotels, little interesting stores. Breakfasts good- melons,olives;cheeses etc. and eating it on rooftop with view of Blue mosque 'Santa Sofia and the Bosphorus was an unforgettable experience. Friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: CherieC515
Reviews.Content: Must agree with Daniel from Florence and cannot understand some of the "glowing" reviews for this poor excuse for a hotel. Summary of my Sept 2011 experience (travelling with adult daughter): Airport transfer not there on arrival; cash demanded on arrival for 3 night stay (a request I declined as the booking was secured by credit card and that is how I intended to pay); service non-existent; 2 br apartment tacky, no cups/tea/coffee/glasses; health & safety nightmare - unsafe electric switches (sparks flew at one stage when plugging in netbook); beds hard as a rock; unable to open windows; balcony door can't be closed from the outside; shower leaked all over bathroom floor; breakfast very ordinary - no coffee available; reception staff rude and boorish. Emails had indicated they would "accept cash" but nothing to show that that was ALL they would accept. Had a stand-up fight with male clerk on departure when I stuck to my guns and said "It's Mastercard or nothing - take your pick". He eventually gave in, most ungraciously. No assistance with luggage when departing early the next morning. I insisted my daughter change hotels as she was staying on for a few days. This should be re-name "Hellish Hotel". Avoid at all costs, despite the excellent location and magical views. Get them off a postcard rather than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and view”
Reviews.Author: zelfren
Reviews.Content: Single lady in 60's, stayed one week in October 2011. No prior knowledge except "tripadvisor reviews", great experience. Room was small but clean, with utterly magnificent 180' view, even better view at breakfast on terrace. Location is ideal - walk everywhere, quiet one way street, with main road and tram very close. Staff were obliging and usually helpful. Ok, so sometimes they're a bit brusque, yet always polite, but I require service, not friendship - so I was happy - especially with the rates so reasonable. Hope to return to Hotel Hali, as Turkey has so much to offer

Reviews.Title: “Hali hotel is the best choice for all kind of trips,a good location with great wiews!”
Reviews.Author: tantza05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hali Hotel a lot of times, alone or with my doughter. This hotel is located central in Sultanahmed, near by Blue Mosque, so it is perfect for holidays and for business trips. In this hotel atmosphere is awsome, the personal is friendly, the rooms are clean. Breakfast is always fresh and the restaurant has a terrace with an amazing wiew. And some of my friends stayed at this hotel because it is also a good value for money, so, I recomand for all tourists to make reservation at HALI HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “MISERABLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND SQUALLID AND TACKY ROOMS SPOIL CENTRAL POSITION AND STUNNING VIEW”
Reviews.Author: danielFlorence_Italy
Reviews.Content: my last time at the HalÄ± hotel was approximately 17 years ago after having patronised it many times since its inauguration in 1988. i came back this year following an attractive cash-payment discounted offer at â‚¬75 per room. due to a strike in italy we arrived late at around midnight. we were "greeted" by an unfriendly receptionist who, with a debatable sense of humour, told us laughing that the hotel was fully booked offering us to spend an open-air overnight in the square nearby eating grass for breakfast. furthermore he tried to ask us the immediate full pre-payment of the room which we refused (he already had my credit card as guarantee so he didn't need anything else). we were exhausted after a long day and didn't appreciate his welcome. "humour" apart we went to our room, facing the front side with a marvellous view of the bosphorus and st.sophia. the room was at the 4th floor of a building next to the HalÄ± hotel and later connected to it with an internal passage. elevator cramped, instructions including emergency ones written in turkish only. room very modest apart the above mentioned stunning view. low ceiling, tacky decoration, holes in the wall, hasty repainting jobs, unmatching armchairs fabric, mock parquetry-style floor tiles. bathroom small but acceptable. air conditioning remote controle not working and lavabo leaking water. problems fixed on following day. where the HalÄ± hotel in my opinion dramatically lacks is in the service provided: near to none. room maids often forgot to replace towels and toilet paper at all, beds were turned up carelessly. receptionist NEVER provided us even the half of a smile, on departure we were not helped to hand the baggage to the taxi, upon leaving and re-entering the hotel we were either not greeted at all or with just a lazy grunt. the comical side of this lack of service came in the (moreover wonderful) breakfast terrace. often the door connecting our top floor with the terrace was forgotten closed so to force us to go down with the elevator cross the interconnected buildings, take the other elevator and go up from the other terrace door (quite practical, huh?!). furthermore breakfast officially begins to be available at 07.30AM but keep in mind that if you want tea or coffee you have to wait at least after 08.00 or boldly go to the kitchen and help yourself (as we did). very often either eggs, bread or butter or all of them were missing without the absolutely untrained waiters noticing it (or not caring enough). the food in itself was not bad at all, despite being a traditional turkish breakfast (cucumber, yoghurt, feta-type cheese, tomatoes, olives and so on, forget mineral water, cakes, sweets and milk) but this incredible lack of service enervated us very much. hotel decoration in common areas is oldish, uncared, dusty and charmless. a tacky hyper-coloured plaster lion welcomes people entering the main door. nonsense flashing christmas tube-lights adorn the entrance columns, a gloomy, almost always unlit and deserted bar daunts anyone wishing to have a drink. 2 free internet PCs are always switched off so to force you to waste several minutes before accessing the web. as a last commentary i would say that the only strong point of the HalÄ± hotel is its strategical position next to divan yolu, grand bazar, blue mosque and st.sophia and especially the stunning view one has from the front rooms and the top terrace, but apart that, the rest is miserably managed with an uncaring and unexperienced staff (a breakfast waitress didn't even understand the english word TEA, luckily i knew how to say it in turkish) and very unwelcoming and rude receptionists. nowadays the hotel seems to be patronised by low-class russians, turkish families with head-covered wives and a few northern europeans. i would definitely NOT recommend it unless for its position and view unless the potential customer is a backpacker or someone absolutely not minding squallid, cramped rooms and total lack of customer service. i personally do regret not having checked more thoroughly other solutions before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, location & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hc1357
Reviews.Content: There is a perfect view of the Blue Mosque, and even better appreciated on the terrace. People are friendly, rooms small but clean. Good value for money. Breakfast is great, consisting of freshly baked bread, fruit, cold cuts, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A dungeon”
Reviews.Author: KristenHawaii
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is that the location is central to all the major sites in Sultanahmet. That said, I would not ever recommend this hotel to any friend of mine. Oh, and the breakfast was pretty good with a nice view from the terrace. The hotel is dark and dingy. Paint peeling off the walls, light switch fell off when I touched it, carpets stained and dirty. This would all have been better if any one person that worked there had a personality. Don't think I've ever been made to feel so unwelcome anywhere in the world. And all I did was give them my money to stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: marjan_k
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel, specially if your staying more than couple of nights, Although it's close to the historic areas but not a comfortable hotel at all, smoking is allowed here and the whole place STINKS big time, my room didn't have fridge and hairdryer. I'm afraid I didn't have a comfortable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: jteaches
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location! Right in the heart of Sultanahmet, it is near every thing- Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. About a 10 min walk is the Spice Bazaar which gets you close to the Bospherous. The hotel itself leaves a bit to be desired. Rooms are small-ish (even for Turkey) and have very little charm. But, the hotel is clean and provides a nice breakfast on the rooftop terrace with wonderful views. The staff could've been a bit more welcoming, but overall, not a bad place for $110 US a night for a room with 2 twin beds and nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel near the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: regshammy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nestled is a side street about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, as a matter of fact our room overlooked it. The hotel is great value for money, in part because of its location, near the tram sation, and generally friendly atmosphere. The hotel provided a buffet typre breakfast which was quite nice, however after a couple of days got a bit boring because of lack of variety. Free wi-fi was also included in the hotel price, which was more or less usable. Maybe the only negative experience was that the air conditioning intake was located under our room and it was making a heavy noise even though one of our neighbours was using the AC. This meant that we had to sleep behind closed doors with our own AC on, which is not my favourite way of sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good !!!”
Reviews.Author: Aabbccddqq
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. excellent service. spacious and clean. perfect toilet. very appropriate price (25 â‚¬ / person x day). excellent location. Close to the tram stop. 5 minuts to santa sofia & blue mausoleum! nothing to add! super recommended! I write only because i have tu use all the 300 characters. By by and have a nice holiday in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the hotel is a bit tatty.”
Reviews.Author: willynillyAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Hali Hotel is in a great convenient location just off the main street with the tram line in Sultanamet. Walk to Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia , cafes, patisseries, restaurants, hop-on-hop-off bus etc. The view from the top floor breakfast room is sensational. The rate seems reasonable comparible to other hotels, however it is a bit tired looking. I had some issues with maintenance problems in my room and they were fixed quickly. The cleaners seemed diligent but were extremely noisy yelling to each other and slamming doors. One strange thing happened. As a solo female traveller I was alarmed to get a bang on my door at midnight waking me up, to be asked by the male receptionist if my air conditioner was working! Was it necessary to ask this at midnight or was there some other reason...?

Reviews.Title: “Yes, indeed, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PercyP_g
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Hali over the past 12 years and each time my experience has been similarly positive. There is a wonderful view from the rooftop terrace. What more could one want when eating breakfast than to see the panorama of Aya Sofya and Sultanahmet Mosque with the Marmara sea and the Bosphorus Bridge as the backdrop? The hotel is located on a quiet street just off Divan Yolu, which is the main street running through the Sultanahmet neighbourhood. It is less than 5 minutes from the tram station and all of the major sights (Topkapi, Aya Sofya, Sultanahmet Mosque, the covered bazaar, the Cemberlitas baths, and the cisterns are just a 10-minute walk away. The staff are very pleasant , the hotel is very clean (though the decor is rather old-fashioned) and there is free wi-fi in the rooms. If you are a woman traveling alone and don't want to spend a lot on your hotel, this is a very good choice, as indeed it would be for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: TX_Flyer001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is has a very central location. The view from breakfast on the terrace is great. The rooms are a bit dated and could use renovating. The only issue I have with this hotel is noise. You can hear everyone open and close doors run water in the bath, or use the toilet. If noise does not bother you then this hotel will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hali Hotel Istanbul was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: skkat
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hali in Istanbul; staff were friendly and helpful; location was great, close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, shopping, many good restaurants. I plan to visit Istanbul and the Hali again.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here 4 times over the last 12 years and will stay there if we visit again”
Reviews.Author: gtlowe45
Reviews.Content: An excellant value B&B hotel with charactor in a square within easy reach of the main attractions of the old part of the city - Ayia Sofia - Blue Mosque - Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar. It has a roof top breakfast room with a spectacular view of the Bodspherous - Ayia Sofia & Blue Mosque where you are served a simple but adequate cold buffet -Turkish Style It is a family run hotel and all the staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and even better location”
Reviews.Author: hart277
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the heart of the old city and very easy to get to all of ther main attractions. My room was a single, but I paid 5 Euro extra and had a view that was amazing. I was one flight of stairs to the breakfast terrace and even better view there, but it really made the mornings very special. Breakfast was great and the service was very nice as well. If I had to pick a problem it was just that I got in earlier and my room wasn't ready, but they took my bags and I was able to walk around the city. You can take a tram with a transfer for a 3.5 tl and it will take 500 feet to the door of the hotel, it might take a little longer then a shuttle, but its a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here again”
Reviews.Author: Kevincat99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Haali Otel twice now and both times it has been really good value The staff are friendly and helpful and cannot do enough for you Breakfast is standard Turkish but fresh and when eaten in the roof top restaurant the view is superb It's location is great about 5 minutes walk from Sultanahmet metro station and 10 minutes easy walk to the Blue Mosque / Hagi Sofia / Topkapi etc Loads of eating places and bars in the area as well It's not luxurious but is clean , welcoming and excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: UrbanArcadian
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful hotel staff. This hotel is ideally situated for a short break in Istanbul. Room 808 was comfortable and clean with overlooking a quiet square and a great view of Hagia Sophia , if a little short on hangers and redecoration appeared to be on hold. Shower room was small but nicely tiled. The view from the room was great but the view from the roof terrace was fantastic, even though not 360 (see hotel web site) it has, probably, one of the best vistas in Istanbul. We would definitely choose this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone who is interested in seeing Istanbul and not the hotel facilities. Located in the heart of the Sultanamet district a great budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...Average”
Reviews.Author: BaronFunkhauser
Reviews.Content: Although I can't say anything was terrible here, I can't say that it anything was that great. It's just your average econo-hotel, but if you're out all day, all you need is a bed, right? While the beds are okay, the bathrooms are tiny, and the walls are tissue-paper thin. When you have a hotel filled with loud extended families who think they own the entire floor, it can be quite noisy - my biggest complaint. So bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel close to all interesting spots in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EricOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for visiting the historic areas of Istanbul. Excellent service, the staff makes their best effort to make you feel like home. Nice room, good bed, a clean and fresh bathroom. In one sentence, a place I will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “once you stay in this hotel, will always stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayesh81
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very idealy located and the staff is very co-ordial and soft spoken and very friendly. the amnities are also very good. the rooms are very spacious. the tariff is reasonable compared to the service and location that we get.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home out of home”
Reviews.Author: AsiatDubai
Reviews.Content: Very good location if u re travelling to Istanbul for sightseeing, fun,good food,and not intending to spend much for a trip.Even travelling solo,a girl or a guy,u d feel safe n not disturbed by any chance or reason.Very nice view from the breakfast terrace to Aya Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: mhmichael
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hali Hotel at least twice a year for the last 12 years. The service is consistently good and the rates very reasonable. The breakfast could use some improvement but considering how reasonably priced the hotel is and how close it is to so many cafes and restaurants, it's not a huge drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: cgiddle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for several years at the wonderful Hali Hotel. The staff are welcoming and helpful (for restaurant reservations, cabs, recommendations for hamams, etc.); the breakfast delicious; the view from the terrace where breakfast is served is the most beautiful in the world. The rooms, while simple, are clean and functional. The location and price of the hotel amazing. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Istanbul. Whether you are with a group, your family, or by yourself, the Hali is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, at a great price, with fabulous service.”
Reviews.Author: saulamca
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, with a heart as big as all of Turkey. Clean, modern, and in a great location. Always warm enough, and with A/C in the summer, it is a wonderful rest up after so many miles walking in this fantastic city. My only suggestion is to upgrade their free breakfast. All else is 5 star - especially the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort in historic Istanbul at a decent price.”
Reviews.Author: Yastiklar
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve returned many times to this agreeable, reasonably-priced hotel. Everyone on the staff is welcoming and helpful, the rooms are clean and bright, and the view from the breakfast terrace is spectacular: the Bosphorus with its ship traffic, the Hagia Sofia and the Sulemaniye and Firuz Aga mosques, all punctuated by flights of seagulls. I prefer to stay in a quieter room at the back of the hotel â€“ no view, but I donâ€™t need that when Iâ€™m asleep! The beds are hard by comparison with the cushiony ones that have become popular in US hotels, but are similar to those Iâ€™ve encountered in hotels and private homes elsewhere in Turkey. The traditional Turkish breakfast is plentiful and fresh, if a bit limited for some preferences (no cold cereals), thereâ€™s a flavorful cherry juice (the orange-colored juice is like Fanta) and thereâ€™s tea and (brewed) coffee. The Hali is ideally located in the midst of historic Istanbul. Museums, mosques and monuments are all in easy walking distance and when youâ€™re ready to venture farther afield, the nearby tram is the best way to go during the day â€“ in Istanbulâ€™s traffic, taxis can take forever. I look forward to my next visit â€“ this is my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very good service and location”
Reviews.Author: ElseRonning
Reviews.Content: Hali hotel is very good located in the old part of the city; in Sultanahmet. The hotel is clean and has a serviceminded staff. The view from the breakfastroom on top of the roof is amazing. We are often in Istanbul and this is "our hotel". Petter & Else from Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in the heart of the historic part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Old_Nick69
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling through istanbul for 10 years or more - usually 2 or 3 times a year. I almost always stay at the Hali Hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The showers are usually "excellent" or "very good". The staff speak English and are very helpful. It is right in the heart of historic Sultanahmet and a short walk from all the major centers of interest. The Tramvay is just round the corner. BUT the best part is the breakfast terrace. You can sit outside and look out over the Bosphorus, Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. The photograph on their web site is a bit optimistic - but then another hotel close by built a huge extension and partly obscured the view of the Blue Mosque! But for us it is a perfect way to start the day. I have stayed in many other Istanbul hotels and B&Bs, but nothing beats the Hali - for us it feels like 'coming home'. The breakfast is nice - but the coffee could be better - we take our own! (but we are picky). We have never had any issues with the staff or cheating with the bill. There are many hotels charging similar rates to the Hali - but their ambience and location are not a patch on the Hali. We have recommended several friends to stay there, and they invariably agree that it is a 'hidden gem' among so many mediocre places.

Reviews.Title: “Hali Hotel suits everyone, the location is excellent and extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: biltravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous Istanbul hotels since 1985. They are all different due to there locations, which in turn dictates the view, access to historical sites and pubic transport. I first stayed at "The Hali Hotel" in 2003, on the advice of several friends. The Hotel is easily reached from the airport, either by taxi, (15-20 minutes) or by metro from the airport, (30 minutes approx, Sultan Ahmet tramway is just 5 minutes walk from Hali Hotel) The first thing I observed on entering the foyer was how efficient everything was, the staff were extremely helpfull and the rooms are always super clean. The view from the terrace is superb, you can almost touch St Sophia and The Blue Mosque, as well as great views of The Bosphorous Waterway. I highly reccomend this hotel for first time travelers to Istanbul, no matter what time you may arrive you will be greeted warmly. Most things that travelers require are within easy reach of this hotel. For disabled people there are lifts and plenty of staff help who speak english. There is a bar which stocks very good Turkish Wines, as well as every thing else you could wish for, also the price includes an excellent "Turkish breakfast" which you eat in the resteraunt at the top floor with 360 degree views over Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “location is great and the staff accomodating”
Reviews.Author: aldeyoung
Reviews.Content: they might want to turn on a few more lights in the lobby and personalize the experience with a few local maps and suggestions, but the "bones" are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent rooms, so go for the view, front of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: moonwolf
Reviews.Content: My first room was the best view of the mosques, city & Bospherus, top floor. However, the toothbrush sized showerhead went off in 14 directions, which was laughable but non-functional. The room was rather shabby but was in the adjoining building, air conditioner (for fresh air) blew on the bed-head all night, not good. But the view!!! Because of tremendous noise of a new building going up adjacent to this one, my room was changed to the original Hali Hotel overlooking the Binbirdirek Park which provided wonderful people & cat watching. The best thing about Istanbul for me was seeing all the dogs & cats free to roam anywhere they chose. They were all healthy, non-neurotic & cared for by everyone. What a joy! Of course, the architecture & history are somethng everyone should see at least once. The second room was wonderful with the best shower & more space & amenities. The hotel is situated in the best possible place for sightseeing & rates are very reasonable. However , not all rooms face east & those in back of the building(s) are without any view & probably why some reviews are unfavorable. Breakfast on the roof was lovely but the juice was awful, leaving a bad aftertaste. The yogurt, cucumbers, hot eggs & feta cheese were great. The service was splendid & we hope they are paid as well as the Sultans who own the place. They deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Ulpian
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting too much for a very reasonably priced hotel in the centre of the old city, but in truth there was nothing to complain about and much to compliment. My room was a bit tired, but clean, and the shower room was spotless with copious hot water, although my friends mentioned that the shower rose was too low. They did have a bath though. There was drilling during the day from construction work nearby, but it stopped at five, and anyway we were out all day. The receptionists all spoke good English and were helpful, and there are two computers in the lobby (not always both working) with free Internet access. The rooftop views are indeed stunning, and the breakfast was typically Turkish cheap hotel, but plentiful, and fresh, with good coffee, jams, fresh bread - white and brown, cucumber, hard boiled egg, yogurt, juice - that sort of thing. If you want luxury and tip-top decor, forget it; if you want a cheap clean room the Hali is fine, and very well placed on a quiet street just off the main drag. Yes, there might be a bit of noise transfer between the rooms, but I wasn't bothered. The clientele is very mixed, with various Europeans, Americans, Syrians, Egyptians and Turkish people all staying. Transfer from Sabiha Gokcen airport to Taksim square was easy; the buses are waiting outside the arrival door and the price, paid on the bus, is 13TL. A taxi from Taksim to the hotel cost us 40 lira, but it took forever in the rush hour. Later in our stay (six nights) we took taxis back to the hotel from Istiklal Caddesi (most vibrant street in Europe?) in the early hours and only paid about 15TL. Ditto on the return journey to Taksim on our departure. Trams, funicular to Taksim and water buses are easy; just buy a load of jetons and keep them in your pocket: very cheap transport at 1.5 TL each. I will definitely stayat at the Hali again.

Reviews.Title: “I would only stay here if I was really stuck for a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Caanaadaa
Reviews.Content: The room had no sound barrier between it and the next room - we could hear every conversation, phone call, and bodily sound coming from the next room. The sound carried into both our bedroom and even more loudly into our bathroom. We don't smoke - but have been in smoking rooms before. This one however was really heavy with the smell of smoke & we could not use the blankets at night because of that (it was late, so we covered our sheets with our bath towels). Of the 5 places we've stayed in Turkey (3 in Istanbul), this was our least favourite breakfast & least favourite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hali Hotel”
Reviews.Author: as55
Reviews.Content: very convenient location, nice rooms, clean, traditional turkish breakfast on terrace with stunning view, service friendly but a bit slow, good and cheap airport pickup service beware of restaurants in the neighbourhood, almost all are tourist traps, I'd recommend lokantas for meals, ready cooked dishes to choose from or Balik ekmek (fish bread ) near Galata bridge or meals in Beyoglu off Istiklal caddesi

Reviews.Title: “good reliable hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: yeshekathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hali Hotel when we first arrived in Turkey at the beginning of May this year. Before travelling around Turkey we checked out other places, mostly in Serkici but decided to book our return visit also at the Hali... why? The position is fabulous, right near the tramway stop and overlooking the Hagi Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The price is as good as you get for this standard in Istanbul - cheaper than many. The breakfast on the wonderful terrace is great - both the food and the fabulous view. The rooms are reliably conmfortable. The staff, while not effusive, are helpful and pleasant. A few little negatives: even though we stayed a total of 6 nights they didn't offer any transfer to the aiport. Rooms are getting a little tired but since the place is consistently full, there is no real incentive to improve them. Our first room had a hopeless shower but the second bathroom, although smaller, was fine. The walls are a bit thin and noise from other guests could be a problem if they are at all noisy. Overall I'd definitely recommend the Hali as a very good option in Sultanahmet but book early - it's often full.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, with good views thrown in”
Reviews.Author: OilRover
Reviews.Content: I must admit I took a chance on the Hali Hotel. The nightly rate was so reasonable that I wondered quite what I had let myself in for. As it turned out the Hali was a delightful place to stay, with a really good homely feel to it. The reception staff were frequently busy, but always helpful. The hotel is located on the brow of the hill overlooking the more delicious parts of Sultanahmet (indeed, the rooftop restaurant is a great way to get ready for the day, or to unwind after a good day out). Again, I can't fault the value aspect. In fact, since I checked in at about 8am, I ended up having three breakfasts during my two-night stay! The bedrooms were good, but apart from the rooftop restaurant there is not much to keep you hanging around with all that wonder outside. Check out the prices and compare. I think you'll find they are very competitive. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants more than a pension, but less than a five-star.

Reviews.Title: “Alright would try other hotels in that area next time.”
Reviews.Author: Senyorita2030
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews stating that the guy who was at the lobby during the day seemed not that friendly, well, maybe he is just that type. I chose the hotel because I stayed in that area (Sultanhamet) before, and it seemed quite convinient to me comparing to Sirkeci, for example.I should say that all hotels in Sultanahmet with that price range are quite similar, do not expect highest quality service and perfect cleanness. Very close to the local attractions. Loads of nice restaurants. The terrace view is really really amazing, well, all nearby hotels have terraces and its normal, its Turkey. The cleanness of the bed linen was alright, new towels everyday. Heating is perfect. One of the things that bothered me was the view from the window, no view to be exact. Only walls and windows of the opposite building 5 meters away from mine. I asked for a room on the upper floor but didnt get an appropriate response. Always try asking for a room on upper levels. I also noticed dust on the wall base right next to the bed. Bathroom was a bit smelly cos theres no window in it but all clean. The breakfast was alright, typical turkish breakfast: bread, cucumbers, tomatoes, cheese, jams, butter. Fresh tea&coffee. Overall, the hotel is alright if you are looking for something simple and not planning to spend all of your time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; clean hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ElvisTaco
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Hali; would stay again. Rooms are spartan, but comfortable and clean. Turkisk breakfast is modest, but with excellent service (and they have brewed coffee, not Nescafe!). Front desk always helpful, good English. Great location on a side street off Divan Yolu (where the Tram runs), between the Hagia Sofia and the Grand Bazaar; you can walk to anywhere in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with great rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: guiafonso
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the highlight of the hotel is its rooftop view, you simply just cant get enough of it. Location is perfect, but the hotel lacks personality. Stayed twice on Hali during our stay in Turkey, the first for 4 nights and the second for only 1 night. The hotel overall is average, and dont offer much more than what you can expect. The first time we had a nice room with a view, but the bathroom was very small with good shower. The second time we slept on a tiny room, with almost no space for our luggage. Same small bathroom as before. Has free internet service (1 desktop and wireless). Would recommend to a friend, but would definetely make a research before reserving Hali again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value -- but could be better”
Reviews.Author: deg99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, very close to attractions and the streetcar that one can take to the train that goes to the airport. The view from the terrace is amazing, but as someone has already pointed out, most of the hotels in this area seem to have a similar terrace. The breakfast is good, but it seemed to be the same every morning (limited selection, but tasty). Our room was clean, but old, so the rug, although vacuumed, looked frayed and was perhaps harboring lots of old dust and bacteria. Nevertheless, the room was clean enough for a budget hotel and the AC worked well. The biggest problem with this hotel was the service. Although we left a tip for the cleaning lady every single day, one day there were no towels in the bathroom. We called reception and asked for towels -- we had to call twice within an hour, because they didn't bother to send up any towels. After waiting 20 minutes after the second call, I went down to reception to find the guy behind the desk deeply engrossed in a personal conversation on the phone -- it was obvious that it was a personal call, because he very quickly hung up. He apologized for having forgotten to send towels up, citing how busy he had been. Yeah, right. Another reception guy -- the one on duty during the day -- was very unfriendly and he was visibly annoyed when we asked him directions to a particular tourist destination. Almost every time I saw him he had an unwelcoming look on his face that made us uncomfortable. That said, there were a few people who were wonderful -- the two ladies who served breakfast were super nice, and we made sure we tipped them well. Overall, the service could be much, much improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...a few things needs improvement!”
Reviews.Author: jillmet
Reviews.Content: The location is what gives this hotel it's popularity. It is just a few minutes away from popular tourist attractions! It is also just a few steps away from the tram line. The breakfast room is lovely with gorgeous views of the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. However, the breakfast is pretty bland (bread, jams, hardboiled eggs, fruit...). All the hotels in the area also had roof top patios for breakfast, so this shouldn't be the one selling feature if you're considering this hotel. The sheets were clean (thank goodness) but the rest of the room needed a good scrub down. There was a lot of dust on the floorboards and it felt really stuffy. However, the AC at night was fabulous! The bathroom also needs a update (blue tile with lots of scum in the corners). The old shower curtain totally grossed me out, it was white on top but brown on the bottom! This is a easy fix and says something about the hotel's pursuit for cleanliness. The rooms are quite big though. The man working the desk during the day was really unfriendly- he rarely said hi or bye! He even got angry with our friends when they arrived late because there train got stuck at the Turkish border! The two guys who work the evening/night shift are very friendly. Also, our friends stayed in a room that had a very funky smell. They had red bites all over their legs and arms by their second sleep in the hotel. We're not sure what bed bugs looks like but they didn't want to complain! There are a lot of other hotels in the area which were much nicer (I went to look at them) which I would suggest checking out before settling with the Hali Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: Hibok-Hibok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is very near to everywhere. Roof top view is perfect. The hotel is clean. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget hotel - right at the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Kev H
Reviews.Content: After much perusing on Trip Advisor, the Hali Hotel was the only hotel in Sultanahment, within my price range, that didn't have at least one horror story review. So I contacted them via their website, and agreed a price for my stay at the end of April, with my partner and handed over my credit card details. I arrived somewhat apprehensively, using the map they had on their website, to find the hotel tucked into a quiet street opposite a peaceful square, set above the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, off the main Divan Yolu road. A great location. We walked inside and immediately settled the room cost for the 3 nights we were there and were shown to our room. The room was clean, warm, with a lovely view. The only downside would be that the decor is perhaps a little tired. The bathroom - including the shower - was also very nice. We slept well on our first night, with sufficient blankets to see off the spring chills which Istanbul can give out, and awoke for breakfast on the floor above us, where the view out to the mosques, Topkapi and the sea of Marmara is just lovely. Tea and coffee were free flowing and good, and the breakfast was very varied. Eggs, 4 different types of cheese, freshly cut salad tomatoes and so forth, as well as olives, bread and preserves etc, were all available. You certainly would not go hungry. Service at the hotel was very efficient. Any questions you had were answered to the best of the staff's abilities, and English was spoken very well. Reception was always manned. The location of the hotel turned out to be even better as we got to know the area better, with a short walk only to the grand bazaar, as well as a fantastic couple of restaurants and the hippodrome, and a top notch turkish barber. If you are looking for a base to explore the historical centre of Istanbul, on a budget, I would strongly recommend the Hali.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeftFork
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Hali Hotel yesterday and really enjoyed it. The location is excellent and the manager printed out our boarding passes for us which was outstanding service. There is a computer in the lobby you can use for internet access which came in handy for us. The first night the guy in the next room talked loudly on the phone all night but that wasn't the hotel's fault. I think bringing ear plugs when you travel is always a good idea. The view from the breakfast room on the top of the hotel was wonderful and the breakfast adequate although I didn't think the coffee was very good but that seems to be a weak spot in much of Istanbul. Another good point was the bathroom with a shower that was actually separated from the rest of the room. The room size was big enough for the two of us but naturally not huge. Although they serve guests breakfast, there is no restaurant but there are plenty just minutes away. We'd go back but remember it is a budget hotel so don't expect the same level of room size and amenities as from a hotel costing two or three times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: IslandSojourner
Reviews.Content: After reading previous positive reviews about the Hali Hotel, I thought I would give it a try since I wanted to try a location away from the intense tourist area behind the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sofia (where I have stayed previously). I emailed the Hali and asked for their best price and was pleased with their offer. I also requested a view room and was promised one. Upon arrival, my teenage son and I checked into room 206 (two single beds) and enjoyed a very nice view of the sea and Aya Sofia from the balcony. The bathroom was very nice and appears to have been recently renovated. The shower stall was large and there was plenty of hot water (except for the day my son decided to shower around noon and only had warm water)! The double-glazed windows made for peace and quiet. We stayed for 3 nights and appreciated the central location. The breakfasts were traditional Turkish fare but the view from the rooftop terrace where breakfast is served is outstanding. The only down side was that the staff were a bit on the unfriendly side - but not rude. They would be wise to sharpen up their customer service and teach the staff to smile and be a bit more personable. However, this would not deter me from staying here again. Keep in mind though that it is a 3-star hotel, so don't expect anything more than that. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The one I always choose...”
Reviews.Author: alisonkusadasi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hali Hotel 4 times simply because you can't beat the location plus it's always good to stay somewhere that you're familiar with. The hotel needs a bit of TLC but the beds and bathrooms are clean; that's the most important thing. Also the rates are very reasonable for a hotel smack bang in the middle of Sultanahmet. When you have all the main sights within a 10 minute walking distance, with no need to get a taxi or tram, it's great!
